item.title: Abandoned Bicycles and Waste Behind Shere House (A2), 24th August
item.description:
Issue concerning the area behind Shere House, specifically the grassy section with a view of the A2. This area has become a dumping ground for abandoned items, particularly bicycles, but also other types of waste. The accumulation of these items is not only unsightly but also attracts further litter and can create an unsafe environment for residents and visitors.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trinity Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars using unrestricted area and blocking cycle lane, 24th August
item.description:
Vehicles are parked outside the Southwark resource centre (SE17 2QB) in an area that seems unrestricted. This parking blocks the cycle lane off Bradenham Close, not leaving any space for bikes to use it which leads cyclists to mount the pavements. Wheelchair users and any one with mobility issues or with pushchairs will have issues moving through this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Boyson Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish dumped, 24th August
item.description:
Could you please remove before it accumulates more rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grafton Road j/o Prince Of Wales Road, 24th August
item.description:
You have a sign that clearly says NO right turn but you have a road marking that clearly says you CAN turn right. Which is it???????????? Which one is legal as i suspect both are. Sort it out please and while you are at it, make sure there are no more of these please as it is dangerous for pedestrians who aren't expecting some dingbat in a car to do the right thing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Grafton Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Glass Hazard Outside Shere House (Apartments 24–31), 24th August
item.description:
Safety hazard outside Shere House, specifically in front of the entrance to apartments 24–31. There is shattered glass on the ground, concentrated near the main entrance door and close to one of the general waste bins (non-recyclable). It appears that something may have been thrown away improperly, causing the glass to break and scatter. In addition to the glass, there is some litter in the same area. Although the largest amount of broken glass is near the entrance, shards are spread across the access road leading to the building. This presents a serious risk to residents and anyone passing through, as it could easily cause injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrick Square, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plants overhanging pavement, 24th August
item.description:
Plants have been allowed to overhang the pavement for several months leaving little room to pass. Also as the plants are mostly lavender, there is a risk to passers-by of being stung by bees.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rodway Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
